page.title: 14INFORMATION SERVICES
page.content: 1985 is the year of the Diamond Jubilee of the Hertfordshire Library Service, which now has over 60 libraries issuing over 13 million items a year. Libraries are gradually being connected to a central computer for the issue and return of books and a computer catalogue will soon be available. People in Hertfordshire borrow 20% more books per head than the average in Britain. About 6,000 books (mostly Fiction, Biography and History) are lent to people in the Rickmansworth area each week. More customers are female than male; but this does not mean that more readers are female because they may be fetching books for other people.The Library is open from 10a.m.to 7.30p.m. with a half day on Saturday. There are 9 staff and they work a 5 day week. The new library was opened in 1968.
